meta.name: Sooraj Krishnakumar
meta.headline: Architecting Scalable Distributed Systems | .NET & Azure Expert
meta.shortIntro: I specialize in building high-performance, resilient microservices architectures. With deep expertise in .NET, Azure, and event-driven patterns, I turn complex business requirements into robust technical solutions.

hero.primaryMessage: Building the invisible backbone of modern digital products.
hero.secondaryMessage: From designing fault-tolerant message queues to optimizing database queries for millions of transactions, I ensure your backend is as reliable as it is fast.

experience.title: Senior Backend Engineer
bullets: Led the migration of a monolithic legacy banking system to a microservices architecture using .NET 6 and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), reducing deployment time by 70%.
Designed and implemented a high-throughput payment processing engine utilizing Azure Service Bus and Redis, handling over 500 transactions per second.
Mentored a team of 5 developers on Clean Architecture principles and Test-Driven Development (TDD).

experience.title: Software Developer
bullets: Developed and maintained RESTful APIs for a global logistics platform using ASP.NET Core.
Optimized SQL Server database queries, improving report generation speed by 40%.
Implemented CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, automating testing and deployment processes.

projects.name: Distributed Event Bus Platform
projects.summary: A centralized event bus framework for internal microservices communication, ensuring reliable message delivery and distributed tracing.
highlights: Implemented the Outbox pattern to guarantee data consistency across services.
Integrated OpenTelemetry for end-to-end distributed tracing and observability.
Reduced inter-service coupling and improved system resilience.

projects.name: Real-time Inventory Sync
projects.summary: High-performance inventory synchronization service connecting multiple e-commerce channels in real-time.
highlights: Built a Kafka consumer group to process inventory updates with sub-second latency.
Utilized Redis for deduplication and caching hot data.
Scaled to handle peak loads during Black Friday sales events.

projects.name: AuthZ Provider Service
projects.summary: Centralized authentication and authorization server supporting SSO for multiple enterprise applications.
highlights: Implemented custom grant types for legacy system integration.
Secured APIs using JWT bearer tokens and fine-grained policies.
Migrated 50,000+ users from legacy databases with zero downtime.

footer.tagline: Built with React, Tailwind, and .NET Zen.
